attributes.action: Ask UK Government to Guarantee the UK membership to the European Research Area.
attributes.background: British Universities in particular benefit from participation in European projects. Access to grants and colleagues from across the EU is vital to our universities and our science. We get out more than we put in. Why lose it?
attributes.additional_details:
UK universities in particular benefit hugely from participation in pan European projects and need reassurance from the Government that will continue. Access to the European Research Area is vital to British science and future generations. A recent parliamentary report strongly backed this position. In the future it could be possible for British business to benefit in the same way as universities. 
 
http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201516/ldselect/ldsctech/127/127.pdf

attributes.action: bring back the nit nurse and give compulsory absence until treatment is complete
attributes.background: parents are fed up with the amount of money we are having to spend on nit lotions just for other parents to be allowed to leave their children covered in nits, untreated and uncomfortable.
attributes.additional_details:
after speaking to other parents we have all agreed we want a nit nurse back and compulsory absence until treatment is complete.
after speaking to the school they are not 'allowed' to single out parents and refuse to send out a letter and the also see it as unauthorised absence if you keep your children on due to them having nits!

attributes.action: Free sun cream for all school children
attributes.background: I have been recently been diagnosed with skin cancer, being only 28 this has come as a bit of a shock. being a red head, fair skinned , and freckly I always kept an eye on skin changes but you still think it wont happen to you. This then flagged up and made me take notice the price of sun cream.
attributes.additional_details:
Every child should have access to sun cream, especially march-October, teachers, anybody in a position of care to a child should be allowed to apply sun cream where they see fit.
Sun damage ages the skin but also raises the risk of skin cancer, one of the most preventable cancer. I believe all school children should receive a 'sunstart' pack containing a sun hat, sun cream, and information sheet, a bottle of water , and an activity pack. FREE SUN CREAM FOR ALL SCHOOL CHILDREN.

attributes.action: Improve continuity of care for students with mental health issues
attributes.background:
One in four of us experience mental health issues in the UK each year.
With 2,266,075 students attending university in the 2014/15 academic year (Higher Education Statistics Agency), we at Hope At Hand are urging the government to not only talk about mental health, but for action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government has no current plans to improve continuity of care for students studying away form home.

Students under the care of mental health teams still face months of waiting lists. By this time students are often back home. Due to their time throughout the year being split between two locations, often students can go their entire student life without much needed mental health care.
Student suicide rates rose by 50% between 2007-11(Office for National Statistics). More needs to be done.

attributes.action: Make it a law that you can not park in a parent and child space without children
attributes.background: Parking in a parent and child space is not about being lazy or closer to the shops. It's about being able to take/put your child in the car safely without another car hitting them. It's also reduces the chance of the car door hitting the car next to you.

attributes.action: Force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay compensation to all season ticket
attributes.background:
I call on the government to force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay monetary compensation to all season ticket holders on Southern operated routes at a level of 20% of their season ticket value. 

GTR recently cut 350 services from all lines added to previous disruption, customers need compensating
attributes.additional_details: Www.bbc.Co.uk/news/uk-england-36701300

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Dangerous Dogs Act 1991'
attributes.background: Everyday innocent dogs around the UK are dragged from their homes, stuffed into kennel's with other petrified dogs away form their owners and are 'destroyed'. A large number of these dogs are just puppies and have never shown any signs of aggression. They are dying due to breed discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Its about time we started to realise that no dogs are dangerous, only owners. We have known this for centuries yet we still allow criminals to breed these types of animals excluded within the Dangerous Dogs Act and we have almost zero accountability over our pet owners within the United Kingdom. 

We must propose a new system in which owners/breeders are held accountable for their animal no matter what breed and encourage education rather than destruction with this issue.

attributes.action: Make it safer for Emergency and Rescue Services working at the road side.
attributes.background: A law in Canada makes it safer for their Emergency & Rescue Services already and it's time to give ours the same protection.   Too many in the UK are injured or killed whilst trying to help others on the roads.  A law to make people slow down and/or move over will help keep everyone safe.
attributes.additional_details:
The law in Canada means that drivers must slow down to at least 60kph (37mph) or move over giving a lane's clearance between themselves and the Emergency/Rescue Service vehicle when it is stopped and displaying flashing lights.   This includes police, fire, ambulance and recovery vehicles. 

The Government are asked to introduce a similar law in the UK to make vehicles slow to 40 on national limit roads or 30 on restricted roads as well as making it compulsory to give a lane clearance when safe.

attributes.action: Refuse to sign up to CETA to Save Our Stilton (and other protected food names).
attributes.background:
This deal between the EU and Canada fails to include any of the UK's Protected Food Names and would allow Canadian food producers to swamp the European market with Stilton, West Country Cheddar, Melton Mowbray Pork Pies, Cornish Pasties etc.
173 EU products are protected but none from the UK
attributes.additional_details:
CETA is a corporate power grab allowing transnationals to sue governments if their future profits are threatened, such as by health warnings on tobacco products, renationalisation of public services or returning the NHS to public control.

Protect our foods, small businesses and public services, and our government’s right to regulate for the environment and the public good. 

Leaving the EU also gets the UK out of CETA and TTIP.  

More information and links at www.StopTTIP.net/Save-Our-Stilton

attributes.action: End the triple lock on State Pension increases that is planned until 2020
attributes.background: The triple lock on the State Pension means it will increase by 2.5%, inflation or earnings (whichever is highest) each year until 2020. As the UK has voted for Brexit, and a recession is likely, it is not fair that pensioners should be protected when those of working age are not.

attributes.action: Cyclists to display identification such as a number plate for accountability
attributes.background:
I believe because cyclists have anonymity some  ignore the Highway Code, creating a danger to themselves, other road users and pedestrians
I have witnessed numerous dangerous, reckless and ignorant actions
Identification and accountability could make the roads a safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce the risk cyclists present to themselves and others. Through accountability  to create a culture of best practice.
In an age of speed cameras and dashboard cams to make the cyclist identifiable when involved or causing incidents.
To promote greater harmony between the motorist and cyclist. To make the roads a safer place for pedestrians.

attributes.action: Following the vote to leave the EU, please form a Government of National Unity
attributes.background: Due to the significance of the decision to leave the EU and the national split in opinion. We now need a cross party group to lead the Nation and work together for the good of all. It cannot be decided by one party alone. We must work together in seizing this opportunity!

attributes.action: A second EU referendum including EU nationals living and working in the UK
attributes.background: 3 millions EU nationals live and work in the UK, contribute to the UK economy and social fabric, pay UK taxes. The results of the EU referendum matter a great deal to them, their (often British) spouses and children. Yet they have been effectively muzzled by voting laws. This needs to be put right.
attributes.additional_details:
A similar petition was dismissed on the following grounds: 
- "historical ties with Irish and Commonwealth citizens resident in the UK". There are also historical ties between the UK and the EU. The UK joined in 1961, 4 years after the Treaty of Rome (free movement of workers).
- "usual practice for referendums in other EU states". True - however at £1,000 the cost of applying for UK citizenship is out of line with other EU states (e.g. cost of applying for French citizenship = €55).

attributes.action: Amend The Cancer Act 1939 to allow advertisement which has scientific proof
attributes.background: The Cancer Act 1939 prohibits advertisement of treatments & cures for cancer due to the large amount of false medicines being sold in the 1930's. In recent years scientific breakthroughs have created more effective treatments which doctors & the wider population are unaware of due to outdated laws.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.caymanchem.com/article/2168
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27196781
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27192495
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24974185
https://gcmaf.se/gcmaf-science/
https://immunocentre.eu/research-papers/

attributes.action: Stop charging premium phoneline rates for Universal Credit claimants.
attributes.background: Despite the DWP making a pledge to provide free calls for "all major benefit claim lines" the helpline for the new Universal Credit will be a 0345 number costing callers up to 45p a minute from mobile networks.  This is a disappointing decision and will penalise those most in need of support.
attributes.additional_details: The introduction of Universal Credit is likely to be problematic for many individuals, with the introduction of a single monthly payment for people in or out of work, merging together some of the benefits and tax credits currently in existence.  Individuals are expected to apply online, however there are many in the UK who do not have sufficient computer skills or online access to do so.  Premium phonelines could be prohibitively costly to those waiting on payments.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum should cannabis be legalized.
attributes.background: Cannabis has been used as medicine for thousands of years let the people decide if we should have access to this medicine in a regulated way or not.

attributes.action: Double All Benefits
attributes.background: All benefits should be doubled. This could be paid for by higher taxes on those more fortunate members of society (e.g Mansion Tax, Higher Corporation Tax etc).

attributes.action: Make impersonation of a Paramedic a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Paramedics work hard to get their registration and lean the skills to save a life,however there is an increasing number of people impersonating paramedics. This puts patient saftey at risk and the police. At present it is not illegal to do this unlike impersonating a police officer.

attributes.action: Support increased needs for End of Life Care in the NHS and social services
attributes.background: Macmillan have warned that funds are desperately needed from the government to support growing numbers of people needing end of life care.
attributes.additional_details:
An extra 15,000 people could be dying of cancer in 2020 in England, compared to in 2010. Macmillan said if the government does not improve support, 65,000 people dying of cancer will have experienced poor overall care in their last three months of life, over the next five years.

http://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/665169/cancer-charity-warns-money-end-of-life-care-treatment

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for elderly people to have an equal standard of medical care
attributes.background: Both my parents suffered unnecessarily at the end of their lives due to a failure in the NHS to provide them with an equal level of care.  Effort is not made to help feed patients who are too ill or infirm to feed themselves, nurses are too stretched and their shifts are too long - change is needed
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has spent any time around their elderly relatives in hospital will notice that there are insufficient resources to cater for their needs - they have to wait for support with toileting, often left in discomfort when bed pans and commodes are not forthcoming. If they are too ill or find it too hard to feed themselves with food or drink there is insufficient help available. When they are in pain they may be given pain relief but the source of the pain is not investigated-this must change

attributes.action: Support the work of Maternity Services Liaison Committees nationwide
attributes.background: Maternity Services Liaison Committees (MSLCs) bring together providers of maternity services and users to improve maternity services at a local level. Many MSLCs are at risk due to a lack of funding. Support should be given to MSLCs to continue and improve on the work they are currently doing.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health And Social Care Act states that NHS England and clinical commissioning group commissioners have a statutory duty to involve patients and the public effectively and systematically. MSLCs have a proven track record in delivering this.

The government/CCGs should commit to funding MSLCs in order to maintain the interaction between providers and users and to support patient involvement in influencing service provision locally.

attributes.action: Monitoring in pregnancy for every woman who has received cervical treatments
attributes.background:
Myself & my fiancé lost our beautiful baby boy, Oscar, after he was born prematurely at 24 weeks. 
My waters broke due to an incompetent cervix that was never checked or monitored despite having part of my cervix removed after a Lletz procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of cells that were removed from my cervix were classified as low risk and therefore no further monitoring or checks were made during pregnancy. Had I been monitored my incompetent cervix would have been diagnosed and our perfect son may be here today. 
I am petitioning for every pregnant woman who has undergone any type of treatment compromising their cervix to be monitored during their pregnancy to prevent baby losses like ours occurring in the future.

attributes.action: Allow Chris brown the artist back into the UK
attributes.background: Since the incident in 2009 when Chris brown wrongfully abused his ex girlfriend Rihanna, he was no longer allowed to enter England, almost 10 years later he still isn't able to visit our country. He has paid his debt to society and publically apologised. He has suffered enough. Bring back brown.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and resale of drop down/side cots
attributes.background: Ashlea-mae lloyd my daughter aged 15mth died due to compression to the neck after her head became trapped in the drop side of these cots 3rd september 2010, darkest day of my life and still haunted to this day. I cannot allow another tragedy like this
attributes.additional_details: Over 70 child deaths recorded since 1970 not including minor/serious injuries to a child 1 death is more than enough. These cots have been banned in America even the resale at carboots/flea markets after millions of of drop down cots were recalled and resulted in yet another infant death in 1996 of which the childs mother bravely campaigned and got them banned, other countries have taken Americas lead in banning these death traps also please please help and support us

attributes.action: A referendum keeping the NHS free for the nation at the service delivery point.
attributes.background: Much publicity has been given to the NHS state, capacity and funding.   To ensure that the NHS is not gifted, sold or used as a political mechanism to further privatisation of the lands, equipment, resources and services presently in provision to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS funding has been restricted to the extent that there is a negative effect on the standards being achieved in patient care, service delivery, restrictions on critical care, the funding of treatments together with staff being in crisis and under valued.  It is time to give the governing elected majority in party parliament a mandate to retain the NHS for the nation or dispose of the NHS by privatisation.

attributes.action: Councils should fund garden waste collection from council tax, no extra charge
attributes.background: Councils across the UK are beginning to charge householders additional money on top of council tax to collect garden waste. Garden waste is generated by the majority of households and has always been collected alongside household waste and more recently recycling. Council tax should fund this.
attributes.additional_details:
The argument that people who live in flats shouldn't be subsidising garden waste collection for households is often put forward. But many people do not have children, but their council tax goes towards schools and other local services. It is a collective local tax to cover local services. Collection of rubbish (household and garden) is clearly a local service that most people need, so should be covered by council tax.

They are exploiting a loophole charging separately for this, and it must end.

attributes.action: Stop sex offenders living within 1 mile of a school or children's facility
attributes.background: We have recently found out there is a sex offender living next door to our children's school and play area and there are no official plans to move him. If this law was passed it would prevent any sex offender living next to your child's school or play area.

attributes.action: If you turn 18 before the end of the academic year you should be able to vote.
attributes.background: Individuals who turn 18 before the end of the academic should be able to vote. As a young person interested in politics born in August, I am extremely disappointed I am unable to vote in the upcoming elections. I am the same maturity as my fellow peers, and I am affected by the outcome equally.
attributes.additional_details: One example I find uncomfortable, is a close peer of mine turns 18 the day after the EU referendum and yet is unable to vote in a decision which is potentially life altering.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for supermarkets to throw away or destroy unsold food
attributes.background:
The House of Lords conducted an inquiry into the amount of food wasted in EU and from that inquiry, it emerged that a staggering 200m tonnes of food is wasted by Asda, Co-operative Food, M&S, Morrisons, Sainsbury’s, Tesco and Waitrose.

Let us make it a criminal offence to waste food.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a report found here http://www.parliament.uk/documents/lords-committees/eu-sub-com-d/food-waste-prevention/154.pdf the UK wastes a shocking amount of food per year. Let us make it a criminal offence for supermarkets to dispose of food just because it is not cosmetically perfect.

Instead of disposing of it, they should look to donate it to food banks and charities who will help feed the homeless and hungry.

attributes.action: HMRC to make tackling tax evaders its top priority.
attributes.background: The concern is that current direction at the HMRC is compromised; with its focus away from the 'privileged' inner-circle, and instead spread ineffectively elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The well known Pareto Principle or 80-20 rule is widely applied in business. It says that the best results are achieved by spending 80 percent of effort on the top 20 percent of prospects by value. Using the same principle; HMRC should target large-sum avoidance by spending 80% of its resources on the top 20% of companies and individuals by the potential revenue that could be recovered.

attributes.action: Full disclosure of the tax affairs of all members of parliament.
attributes.background: We require transparency on the personal tax activities of members of parliament where they conflict with government policy. Following the Panama Papers leak we demand to know if MPs are involved in tax evasion. We therefore request a full disclosure of all members of parliaments' tax affairs.

attributes.action: Will Govnt allow companies to offer communications services which can't be read?
attributes.background:
It was not clear what I am asking the government to do last time?!

I would like the government to ANSWER A SIMPLE QUESTION!

That is what I would like it to do...

The above question - please answer it.
attributes.additional_details:
It is possible to send secret/private communications using nothing more than pen and paper and dice which cannot be read by anyone else, not even GCHQ or NSA. So terrorists and criminals can communicate anyway.

But the Investigatory Powers Bill asks companies to remove any "protection" someone has applied. This can only serve to invade privacy of the rest of us!

So the question is whether the government wish to allow iMessage, WhatsApp, Signal, https, etc, with no intercept, or not?

Yes/No?

attributes.action: Public apology of UK Government to EU immigrants
attributes.background:
We EU immigrants are hardworking people who want to contribute to the community and we refuse to be portrayed in demeaning light as scroungers. 
We come to work here and pay our taxes. We contribute a huge amount to the UK. We do pay in more than we take out.
attributes.additional_details:
We are being defined as a 'problem', or 'crisis', with bigotry being stoked up against, and as EU citizens living here being denied a voice.
Xenophobia and racism been raised by the referendum campaign which is pulling out hidden hatreds all over the country towards  EU immigrants and have a negative effect on our lives. It fuelled race-based discrimination.
We demand public apology of UK Government and recognize us as British citizens to stop a torrent of racism unleashed by EU referendum.

attributes.action: Reduce the 5 day working week to 34.5 hours over 4 days for the same pay.
attributes.background:
In a world where the weekend disappears in a nanosecond, workers are underpaid and overworked. 

The aim of this petition is to reduce the average working week by 3 hours allowing flexible working (4 day week, optional 5 days as chosen by the employee) for companies with more than 20 employees.
attributes.additional_details:
This would; help the economy (people at work spend less), increase productivity, reduce unemployment and ensure a better quality of life.    

France’s 35-Hour Week: Attack on Business? Win-Win Reform? Or Betrayal of Disadvantaged Workers? Politics & Society December 2006 34: 503-542,

attributes.action: The removal of umbrella companies as payment option
attributes.background: We work on zero hour contracts which is fine because we are contractors but therefore we shouldn't be stung by payment companies charging us n.I contributions for both us and our employers

attributes.action: Parliament to make 24th June a  public bank holiday if the UK vote to leave EU
attributes.background:
If the people of the UK choose to leave the European Union on the 23rd June we request that the British Parliament mark the event / people's decision with a Public Bank Holiday to be known as Britain Independence day from Europe.
(This is about the Country being free of Europe, not race/ religion )

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for people with long term mental illness
attributes.background: There is no form of income support for prescriptions for people suffering with long term mental illness mental illness in the long term can have the same debilitating effects as physical impairments and can make you unfit for work so people who suffer with mental illness should get help to pay
attributes.additional_details: To get free prescriptions you need to be; 60 or over, under 16, be 16-18 and in fulltime education, have a MatEx certificate, have a MedEx certificate or you receive either: Income Support, Income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance, Income-related Employment and Support Allowance, or Pension Credit Guarantee Credit

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to work shifts with Doctor's and Nurses to comprehend NHS stress.
attributes.background: Jeremy Hunt is killing the NHS. He is obviously oblivious to the basics of emergency, frontline care and the stress, hard work and dedication put into caring for the general public in a life or death situation, throughout the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: He needs to see evidence of his wrong doing, feel the stress himself, watch what his plans are doing and then will not alter doctors contracts, will employ more nurses and stop cuts.

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about behaviour of MPs during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: MPs may raise Points of Order during House of Commons’ debates if they think that an MP has said something offensive or inappropriate. There is no way for members of the public to do this. Members of the public should be able to raise matters of concern with the Speaker, for reporting to the House.
attributes.additional_details: For instance, it was customary for the Speaker to report to the House the conviction of a member by a criminal court even if the sentence did not disqualify them from remaining a member of the House (an example being Mr. Saklatvala in 1926).

attributes.action: Re-open Hemel Hempstead Hospital
attributes.background: Sign to try help re open Hemel Hempstead hospital.

attributes.action: Make youth services a statutory provision for local authorities.
attributes.background: At present, local authorities do not need to provide youth services, legally. As a result of this, the majority of LA's have axed their youth services.This petition would seek to protect youth services in law, so that young people have a strong support network and develop skills people need for life
attributes.additional_details: A government report into the 2011 London Riots linked the closure of youth provision in North London to the violence seen in London. It costs  £200,000 of taxpayers money for every young person who passes through the criminal justice system by the age of 16 (Audit Commission). For every young person who accesses youth services, it costs £350 per young person.That's a huge amount of money saved. By protecting young services we not only save money,we help to build confident and skilled individuals

attributes.action: Properly clarify status of encryption in The Investigatory Powers Bill
attributes.background: The draft bill suggests that communications providers may have to remove "protection". The joint committee says the bill should make clear that this be only where technically practicable. This does not quite go far enough. We need a clear statement allowing CPs to offer secure communications.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill MUST make clear that CPs can offer secure communications which cannot be read or intercepted even with a warrant or with an intercept order or order to maintain an intercept capability.

Without this people (in UK and overseas) cannot trust CPs offering secure communications, and trust is essential in this industry.

Even as worded now, the bill allows criminals to communicate using own encryption, so that battle is lost. We need to allow non-criminals the same benefit using CP services

attributes.action: Have mental health nurses working with schools in the same way school nurses do.
attributes.background: As part of the targeted mental health in schools scheme the government has tried to improve mental health education to children of school age but it is not about teaching mental health its about providing support for both staff and students.
attributes.additional_details:
Having mental health nurses in schools enables comprehensive mental health service delivery at the heart of education taking responsible away from teaching staff who's sole responsibility is to teach and brings in professionals trained to deal with these specific issues.

Figures have shown increases year after year of children school aged suffering from mentally ill health but it doesn't have to be bringing in mental health nurses at an early intervention stage will promote mental health and emotional wellbeing when transition to college, university or the world of work. 

It's about time we stand up for the children of today, the adults of tomorrow and support them through their hardships by giving them the tools that only mental health nurses can provide in their time of need

attributes.action: We want to stop event organisers charging 'booking fees' added to every ticket
attributes.background: It has become normal for event organisers to charge a 'booking fee' to every transaction and usually added to the face value of every ticket. This is not a booking fee and does not reflect any cost incurred by the event organiser in selling tickets.
attributes.additional_details: Booking fees may have stemmed from third-party sales of event tickets but are now charged by event organisers themselves, as a way of hiking the face value of tickets. The event organiser does not incur any additional cost in selling tickets - this is the normal course of their business, and the equivalent of a supermarket charging a 'shopping fee.'

attributes.action: Pressure the UN to protect hospitals from illegal attacks in war zones
attributes.background: Hospitals have been the target of many recent attacks in Syria. All those involved in the death of civilians, health care workers and destruction of hospitals need to be indicted for war crimes. Healthcare workers must be protected. The UK government should put pressure on the UN to do this.
attributes.additional_details:
"Healthcare is seen as a weapon – you take out a doctor, you take out 10,000 people they can’t care for" 

Over 60 MSF hospitals in Syria have been bombed. 

We need to ensure that humanitarian aid reaches the victims of conflict and does not itself succumb to violence. 

Destruction of hospitals is leaving civilians in war zones without much needed healthcare. The UN security council, the UK government and all the powers involved in the region must do more, for the simple sake of saving lives.

attributes.action: Fix the age for entitlement to the state pension to 60 for both men and women
attributes.background:
With high UK unemployment this would free jobs held by people at 60 years of age and older who wish to retire and release them for the unemployed and youth of the country.
This would be funded by the reduction to the welfare budget by those who come off benefits and instead would be paying taxes.

attributes.action: STOP the roll out of PIP in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency opens
attributes.background: Currently the Conservatives are rolling out PIP around Scotland affecting millions of people but I think this should be stopped in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency in announced and operating

attributes.action: Compensate schools for increased costs - reverse the 8% spending cut per pupil.
attributes.background: State schools in England face a budget crisis because of increased National Insurance and pension contributions. They will need to find savings of around £1bn per year to balance their budgets in coming years. Class sizes are increasing and teachers are already being made  redundant as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
From the Institute of Fiscal Studies, publication 8027

“increasing costs and increasing pupil numbers mean that resources per pupil are likely to fall significantly.”

“school spending per pupil is likely to fall by around 8% in real terms (based on a school specific measure of inflation) between 2014–15 and 2019–20.”

“this will be the first time since the mid-1990s that school spending has fallen in real terms (when spending per pupil fell by 3.6% in real terms between 1993 and 1997).”

attributes.action: Immediately Ban The Artificial Fluoridation Of UK Water Supplies
attributes.background:
Fluoride has recently been classified as a developmental neurotoxicant by the prestigious scientific journal The Lancet, proven to lower a child's IQ: http://goo.gl/5RFiDA

Fluoride is associated with impaired thyroid function resulting in depression, fatigue and weight gain: http://goo.gl/NfzxkI
attributes.additional_details:
Fluoride is linked to dental fluorosis that damages teeth: https://goo.gl/Lw2ebN

Fluoride is damaging to both human and environmental health: https://goo.gl/HXV8Vi

Only four European Union countries back water fluoridation and Germany, the Netherlands and Sweden have discontinued it: http://goo.gl/cVdqwH

Ireland has proposed a 5 year prison sentence for people adding fluoride to the water: http://goo.gl/j8vIkK

It's time for the UK to join these countries for health of the population.

attributes.action: Better care and treatment of people with Neurological Disorders, under UK Law
attributes.background: There are many of British Citizens today, living with various Neurological Disorders, but unlike people with Mental Health issues, there are no strategies, for their conditions, the above when being dealt by the Police or CPS, they also want to treated equally under UK Law.
